aes_encryption_strength_for_data_at_rest.fact_name: AES encryption strength for data at rest (current standard)
aes_encryption_strength_for_data_at_rest.source_sentence: [Cloud Hosting Service] on which [Company Name]'s customers' data resides, encrypts all customer content stored at rest using AES256, except a small number of Persistent Disks created before 2015 that use AES128.
aes_encryption_strength_for_data_at_rest.context: Encryption strength for customer content stored at rest

aes_encryption_strength_for_data_at_rest.fact_name: AES encryption strength for data at rest (legacy disks)
aes_encryption_strength_for_data_at_rest.source_sentence: [Cloud Hosting Service] on which [Company Name]'s customers' data resides, encrypts all customer content stored at rest using AES256, except a small number of Persistent Disks created before 2015 that use AES128.
aes_encryption_strength_for_data_at_rest.context: Encryption strength for persistent disks created before 2015

on_call_engineer_coverage.source_sentence: On-call engineer: 24/7/365 reacts to system outages; Informs service owners and other interested (impacted) parties about the system outage;

on_call_engineer_coverage.reference: Roles and responsibilities - Introduction + Owner + Approver + Last Approved + Scope and applicability + Roles and responsibilities (Section 1)

recovery_time_objective.source_sentence: [Company Name] commits externally to an RTO of 72 hours.
recovery_time_objective.context: Maximum allowed downtime for system resources before unacceptable business impact
recovery_time_objective.reference: Requirements for the production availability - Definitions + General companyʼs DRP + Requirements for the production availability + Monitoring and notification (Section 2)

recovery_time_objective.value: between an hour and a day
recovery_time_objective.source_sentence: an RTO of between an hour and a day, which allows for a warm failover in a disaster scenario, with some components of the application running all the time in a standby mode - such as databases - while others are scaled out in the event of an actual disaster, such as web servers.
recovery_time_objective.context: Timeframe for restoring operations after a disaster
recovery_time_objective.reference: Disaster Recovery Plan, first section - Disaster Recovery Plan + Create and deploy DRP + Activation and notification stage (Section 12)

recovery_point_objective_customer_facing.fact_name: Recovery Point Objective (RPO) for customer-facing applications
recovery_point_objective_customer_facing.source_sentence: [Company Name]'s customer-facing applications have an RPO of an hour, so they take advantage of asynchronous replication.
recovery_point_objective_customer_facing.context: RPO defines the maximum targeted period in which data might be lost due to a major incident.
recovery_point_objective_customer_facing.reference: Approach for data availability - Disaster Recovery + Approach for data availability + Monitoring of database backup creation and restoration (Section 5)

database_backup_frequency.source_sentence: [Company Name] backs up every 30 minutes of databases with customers' data, logging, and billing information to another [Cloud Hosting Service] region.
database_backup_frequency.context: Frequency at which customer data, logging, and billing databases are backed up to another region.
database_backup_frequency.reference: Approach for data availability - Disaster Recovery + Approach for data availability + Monitoring of database backup creation and restoration (Section 5)

postgres_snapshot_frequency.source_sentence: Postgres machines have hourly snapshots of their data drives, so restoring from those snapshots and replaying the queues should result in very little to no data loss.
postgres_snapshot_frequency.context: Frequency of data drive snapshots for Postgres machines
postgres_snapshot_frequency.reference: Data loss - Disaster Recovery Plan + Data loss + Recovery + Impact + [Company Name] Status + Data loss + SQL outage + Recovery (Section 7)

disaster_recovery_plan_review_frequency.value: annually or whenever significant changes occur
disaster_recovery_plan_review_frequency.source_sentence: It is essential that the DRP be reviewed and updated annually or whenever significant changes occur to any plan element to ensure that new information is documented and contingency measures are revised if required.

security_training_frequency.source_sentence: During quaterly security training, employees are regularly introduced to various cyber security threats and the importance of anti-virus protection as an integral component of our security measures.
security_training_frequency.context: Frequency of employee security training sessions
security_training_frequency.reference: 6. User awareness - 6. User awareness + 7. Violation of the policy + Antivirus Management + Procedure + History of the document (Section 7)

security_training_frequency.fact_name: Data awareness and privacy training frequency
security_training_frequency.source_sentence: [Company Name] shall hold annual data awareness and data privacy trainings to ensure data protection standards and best practice are communicated across the organization.
security_training_frequency.context: Frequency of mandatory data awareness and privacy training for employees
security_training_frequency.reference: Data Protection - Data Protection + Review + Legal + Data Anonymization + Data Management + Policy (Section 9)

security_training_frequency.source_sentence: In addition, they also pass the security training during onboarding and repeat it monthly.

data_retention_requirements_review_frequ.source_sentence: Management shall review data retention requirements during the annual review of this policy.

data_retention_requirements_review_frequ.reference: Review - Data Protection + Review + Legal + Data Anonymization + Data Management + Policy (Section 9)

event_data_deletion_period.source_sentence: Event Data ... 90 days unless the customer account is deleted.

event_data_deletion_period.reference: Data Management Policy / APPENDIX B – Data Retention Additional Guidance - Customer Accounts: + Data Management + Policy + APPENDIX B – Data Retention Additional Guidance (Section 11)

event_data_deletion_after_account_deleti.fact_name: Event data deletion after account deletion
event_data_deletion_after_account_deleti.source_sentence: If customer organization account is deleted, within 24 hours of organization deletion.

employee_data_retention_period_after_emp.source_sentence: Retain for the duration of employment + minimum 6 years after employment.
employee_data_retention_period_after_emp.context: Retention period for employee data after employment ends

financial_data_retention_period.reference: Data Management Policy / APPENDIX B – Data Retention Additional Guidance - Customer Accounts: + Data Management + Policy + APPENDIX B – Data Retention Additional Guidance (Section 11)

access_rights_review_frequency.source_sentence: Administrators shall perform access rights reviews of production systems on at least a semi-annual basis to verify that user access is limited to systems that are required for their job function.
access_rights_review_frequency.context: Frequency with which administrators must review access rights of production systems

maximum_access_termination_period.source_sentence: The maximum allowable time period for access termination is 24 business hours.
maximum_access_termination_period.context: Maximum allowable time to remove access after employment or contract termination or change in job function
maximum_access_termination_period.reference: Removal & Adjustment of Access Rights - Full Document (Section 1)

security_objectives_and_principles_revie.fact_name: Security objectives and principles review frequency
security_objectives_and_principles_revie.source_sentence: [Company Name] reviews security objectives and principles at least annually to reflect internal and external factors and requirements of the interested parties.
security_objectives_and_principles_revie.context: Frequency of reviewing security objectives and principles

information_security_risk_assessment_fre.source_sentence: Information security risk assessments are conducted by the GRC team annually or upon significant change to the business, IT systems or [Company Name]ʼs products.
information_security_risk_assessment_fre.context: Frequency of information security risk assessments by GRC team

information_security_risk_assessment_fre.source_sentence: An quaterly risk assessment covering the enterprise, including information assets as part of the initial implementation of the Information Security Management System (ISMS).
information_security_risk_assessment_fre.context: Frequency of enterprise-wide risk assessments as part of ISMS implementation
information_security_risk_assessment_fre.reference: Criteria for performing information security risk assessments - Criteria for performing information security risk assessments + Risk Assessment Methodology + Establish scope and context (Section 2)

information_security_risk_assessment_fre.source_sentence: The annual risk assessment results shall be communicated to top management.
information_security_risk_assessment_fre.context: Specifies that risk assessment results are communicated annually
information_security_risk_assessment_fre.reference: Risk monitoring and reporting - Management approval + Risk monitoring and reporting + Regular review + Maintenance of the Risk Register/Treatment Plan (Section 11)

information_security_and_company_objecti.fact_name: Information security and company objectives risk review frequency
information_security_and_company_objecti.source_sentence: Risks to achieving information security and general companyʼs objectives are assessed and reviewed at the quarterly Board meetings and during the annual and quarterly OKRs planning process.
information_security_and_company_objecti.context: Frequency of risk reviews at Board meetings

vendor_review_frequency.source_sentence: The vendor risk level will determine the level of diligence in the initial review and annually thereafter.
vendor_review_frequency.context: Frequency of ongoing vendor reviews after initial onboarding
vendor_review_frequency.reference: Monitoring, Evaluation & Review of Vendors and Integrations - Full Document (Section 1)

policy_review_frequency.source_sentence: This policy will be reviewed annually.
policy_review_frequency.reference: Vendor Management Policy - Policy - Full Document (Section 1)

high_risk_vendor_compliance_review_frequ.fact_name: High risk vendor compliance review frequency
high_risk_vendor_compliance_review_frequ.source_sentence: Annual compliance review of security documents (i.e CAIQ, SiG, white-papers) and certificates (ex: SOC 2, ISO 27001).
high_risk_vendor_compliance_review_frequ.context: Frequency of compliance review for high risk vendors
high_risk_vendor_compliance_review_frequ.reference: Renewal Vendor Review Criteria - Full Document (Section 1)

document_review_frequency.source_sentence: This document shall be reviewed annually for approval.
document_review_frequency.context: Frequency with which the risk management policy document is reviewed for approval
document_review_frequency.reference: The Risk assessment and treatment process - Introduction + Owner + Approver + Last Reviewed + Roles and Responsibilities + The Risk assessment and treatment process (Section 1)

risk_likelihood_grading_scale.source_sentence: Graded on a numerical scale of 1 (low) to 5 (high).
risk_likelihood_grading_scale.context: Numerical scale used to grade risk likelihood
risk_likelihood_grading_scale.reference: Risk Management, Assessment, and Treatment Policy - Likelihood Determination - Perform Risk Analysis + Likelihood Determination + Risk Management, Assessment, and Treatment Policy (Section 4)

risk_impact_grading_scale.source_sentence: The impact of each risk will be graded on a numerical scale of 1 (low) to 5 (high).
risk_impact_grading_scale.context: Numerical scale used to grade risk impact

risk_score_threshold_high_classification.fact_name: Risk score threshold for High classification
risk_score_threshold_high_classification.source_sentence:
Each risk will be allocated a classification based on its score as follows:

- High: 12 or more
risk_score_threshold_high_classification.context: Defines the minimum risk score for a risk to be classified as High
risk_score_threshold_high_classification.reference: Risk Management, Assessment, and Treatment - Risk Management, Assessment, and Treatment + Policy + Risk Management, Assessment, and Treatment (Section 7)

risk_score_range_medium_classification.fact_name: Risk score range for Medium classification
risk_score_range_medium_classification.source_sentence:
Each risk will be allocated a classification based on its score as follows:

- Medium: 5 to 10 inclusive
risk_score_range_medium_classification.context: Defines the risk score range for a risk to be classified as Medium
risk_score_range_medium_classification.reference: Risk Management, Assessment, and Treatment - Risk Management, Assessment, and Treatment + Policy + Risk Management, Assessment, and Treatment (Section 7)

risk_score_range_low_classification.fact_name: Risk score range for Low classification
risk_score_range_low_classification.source_sentence:
Each risk will be allocated a classification based on its score as follows:

- Low: 1 to 4 inclusive
risk_score_range_low_classification.context: Defines the risk score range for a risk to be classified as Low
risk_score_range_low_classification.reference: Risk Management, Assessment, and Treatment - Risk Management, Assessment, and Treatment + Policy + Risk Management, Assessment, and Treatment (Section 7)
